metadata.Title: CVE-2020-15570 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The parse_report() function in whoopsie.c in Whoopsie through 0.2.69 mishandles memory allocation failures, which allows an attacker to cause a denial of service via a malformed crash file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-15570` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwhoopsie0 - 0.2.52.5ubuntu0.5
whoopsie - 0.2.52.5ubuntu0.5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: whoopsie package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.2.52.5ubuntu0.5').
